titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William E. Simms, Indictment
CWG1013

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Bourbonn CIRCUIT COURT.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
William E. Simms

THE GRAND JURY of Bourbon county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse William E. Simms of the
Crime of Treason,
committed as follows, viz: The said William E. Simms on the 24th day of November 1862, in the county aforesaid, being an inhabitant of and residing in said Commonwealth, in the county aforesaid, and owing allegiance and fidelity to said Commonwealth, did unlawfully, maliciously and traitoriously, compass, imagine and intend to raise and levy war, insurrection and rebellion against said Commonwealth; and the said with a multitude of persons unknown to this Grand Jury, did assemble themselves together in said Commonwealth; armed with guns, swords and other warlike weapons, to be used traitoriously against said Commonwealth, and did, then and there, wickedly, unlawfully and maliciously ordain, prepare and levy war publicly against said Commonwealth, contrary to the duty of his allegiance and fidelity and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

WITNESSES:
R M. Buckner
R. T. Grimes
S. Clay Jr
F. Troutman
Ben Schooler
Allen Bashford

A copy att James Paton Clk
By Ben G. Paton D.C

Bourbon County
vs
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
agt } "copy" Indictment for treason
William Simms
A True Bill
C S. Brent
Foreman
Filed Novr 29th 1862
Bench Warrant issd Dec 3rd 1862
1863 Apr Filed away with leave to reinstate on Docket
A Copy Att J. Paton clk
By Ben G. Paton D C
Fee 50Â¢ paid 23d Oct 1865
Respited until end next General Assembly,
